main event: Observers in Kirksville, Missouri watched a bright star-like object in the western sky for over an hour, which appeared to be a grouping of three to four stars moving together slowly.
interesting points: The object was observed moving down from an elevation of 270 degrees at a slow speed,Military personnel saw a similar light moving erratically in the sky for 30 to 45 minutes,Observers noted that the object had a fuzzy golf ball shape when viewed with binoculars,The object changed appearance to a burnt orange hamburger shape as it moved,The observations suggest a pattern in numerous sightings in the area during the same time.
witness description: 1st Lt. William E. Alt, a Communications Electronics/Intelligence Officer, described the sighting with good reliability.
